background: A company is determining the optimal production levels of multiple products to maximize profit while managing resource constraints and fulfilling minimum order commitments.
constraints: The production of all products must not exceed ResourceAvailability
The production of all products must satisfy MinimumOrderRequirements
Production numbers must be non-negative integers
objective: Maximize the total profit from product sales while adhering to resource limits and minimum order commitments.
description: A company has a limited amount of resources \var{ResourceAvailability} which must be distributed among several products. Each product has a different resource consumption \var{ResourceConsumption} and generates a different profit \var{ProfitPerUnit}. The company must fulfill specific minimum order requirements \var{MinimumOrderRequirements} for each product. The goal is to find the optimal production levels to maximize profit.

parameters.definition: Minimum production requirements for each product
Resource consumption per unit of each product
Profit per unit of each product
